site_name: Development Site On Site Of Former Mosque Numbered 54
description: APPLICATION FOR RELOCATION OF CAR PARKING AND CYCLE PARKING
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development to which this permission relates shall be commenced not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.
Condition : 2 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: P-AL(00)001 and P-AL(00)002

Condition : 3 - The development hereby permitted shall not be occupied until further details of the proposed fencing and gates have been submitted to and approved by the Local Authority. The fencing and gates should be a 354 weld mesh design to security standards LPS 1175 Issue 8: B3 or equivalent with a height of at least 2.4metres. The gates design should incorporate measures to prevent lifting, or climbing aides.

Reason: To ensure the safety of pedestrians and vehicles and the amenities of the surrounding area, and to comply with the following Development Plan policies for Merton: policies 6.3, 6.14 & 7.15 of the London Plan 2016, policy CS20 of Merton's Core Planning Strategy 2011 and policies DM T2 & DM EP2 of Merton's Sites and Policies Plan 2014.

Condition : 4 - The development hereby permitted shall not be occupied until further details of the proposed cycle parking have been submitted to and approved by the Local Authority. The storage should have 'walls' open to surveillance so to view the individual stands. The wall should be constructed of materials such as polycarbonate or grilles. The store should be lit after dark and the locking system of the door must be operable from the inner face by use of a thumb turn to ensure that persons are not accidently locked in.

Reason: To ensure satisfactory facilities for cycle parking are provided and to comply with the following Development Plan policies for Merton: policy 6.13 of the London Plan 2016, policy CS18 of Merton's Core Planning Strategy 2011 and policy DM T1 of Merton's Sites and Policies Plan 2014.

Condition : 5 - The development hereby permitted shall not be occupied until the area is covered by a CCTV system which should incorporate night time provision.

Reason: To ensure the safety of pedestrians and vehicles and the amenities of the surrounding area and to comply with the following Development Plan policies for Merton: policies 6.3 and 6.14 of the London Plan 2015, policy CS20 of Merton's Core Planning Strategy 2011 and policy DM T2 of Merton's Sites and Policies Plan 2014.

Condition : 6 - In accordance with paragraph 38 of the NPPF, The London Borough of Merton (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to development proposals focused on solutions. LBM works with applicants/agents in a positive and proactive manner by:

   i) Offering a pre-application advice and duty desk service. 
   ii) Where possible, suggesting solutions to secure a successful outcome.
   iii) As appropriate, updating applicants/agents of any issues that may arise in the processing of their application.

In this instance:

   i) The application was acceptable as submitted and no further assistance was required.
   ii) The application was approved without delay.
